main event: Two round objects, 40 ft in diameter, colored white, were sighted in San Pedro, California on March 11, 1957.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 20 seconds,The objects were thought to be JATO or Navy-related as they flew straight and then faded out,The reporting officer considered it unusual and believed it could not have been a visual effect,The objects were tracked on radar and observed visually,The sighting includes a detailed description by Robert Dunlap, Assistant Chief Control Center.
witness description: Robert Dunlap, Assistant Chief Control Center, Los Angeles Air Defense Command
